parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Feminine of planos; objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To veil, hide, conceal, envelop. Akin to klepto and krupto; to cover up.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
